task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a sequence of perception, approach, grasp, and lift actions.

task_long_description.overview: The robot must locate, approach, and pick up a red cylindrical object from a black tabletop, as observed in the provided 3x3 image sequence. The episode showcases the robot end-effector progressing from perceiving the object to completing a secure grasp and lifting it above the table. The action requires object detection, alignment, careful descent, grasp execution, and post-grasp elevation, ensuring the object is stably held.
preconditions: Red object is present on an unobstructed tabletop.
Robot is initialized, gripper unoccluded, sensors operational.
No unexpected obstacles around the object.
stepwise_plan: Confirm red object is visible; else initiate scan.
Move to a position above the red object.
Precisely descend and align with target.
Lower until gentle contact with object/table.
Close gripper to grasp the object with standard force.
Verify object is held in gripper.
Lift the held object vertically above the table surface.
success_criteria: Red object is securely grasped by the robot gripper.
Gripper lifts the object cleanly from the table.
No object slippage or drop is observed during elevation.
failure_and_recovery: If the object is not visible, retry scan up to 3 times.
If grasp fails, retry picking procedure from detection.
If object is not confirmed in gripper, trigger recovery or abort.
task_long_description.termination: Episode ends when the object is successfully picked up and clear of the table surface, or after the retry/timeout thresholds are reached.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red object is visible to the robot.
Performs up to 3 raster scans to locate the red object if not initially visible.
Detects the pose of the red object.
Opens the gripper to appropriate width for grasping the red object.
Moves the gripper to a position above the red object.
Carefully approaches and aligns with the red object.
Lowers gripper towards object until gentle contact detected.
Closes gripper with standard force to grasp the object.
Checks if the red object is successfully grasped.
Raises the grasped red object above the table.

failure_modes: Gripper fails to close or does not grasp object
Timeout in movement or perception action
recovery_strategy: Retry perception or scanning up to 3 attempts
Reset grasp if object not confirmed in gripper
assumptions: Frames clearly show a single red object and corresponding gripper behaviors that match the pick-up task.
No evidence of 'place' in the episode; instruction and frames are aligned.

expected_success_criteria: Red object is securely held in the gripper and raised from the table.
No damage to object or robot observed.
